question: Description: Responsible for the nation's foreign policy and diplomatic relations with other countries.
Description: Manages the government's finances, including taxation, revenue collection, and currency production, as well as overseeing economic policy and financial regulation.
Description: Oversees the nation's military forces and conducts defense policy, including the Army, Navy, Air Force, and Marines.
Description: Enforces federal laws, including prosecuting cases, providing legal advice to the President, and managing federal prisons.
Description: Manages and conserves the nation's natural resources, including national parks, public lands, and wildlife conservation.
Description: Supports agriculture and rural development, ensures food safety, and administers nutrition assistance programs.
Description: Promotes economic growth, conducts the U.S. Census, administers patents and trademarks, and oversees trade policy.
Description: Enforces labor laws, promotes workers' welfare, and administers programs related to workplace safety, wages, and employment opportunities.
Description: Oversees public health, including administration of Medicare and Medicaid, and manages health-related research, programs, and services.
Description: Promotes affordable housing, urban development, and community development, and administers housing assistance programs.
Description: Manages the nation's transportation systems, including highways, air travel, and public transit, and develops transportation policies.
Description: Oversees energy policy, research, and development, and manages the nation's nuclear weapons program and energy resources.
Description: Administers federal education programs, establishes education policy, and promotes educational excellence and equity.
Description: Provides healthcare, benefits, and support services to eligible veterans and their families.
Description: Oversees national security, including safeguarding against terrorism, securing borders, and responding to natural disasters and other emergencies.
